mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Franklin H. Williams with Lloyd Greenwood and Isaac Woodward of Blinded Veterans Association.

mods:physicalDescription.mods:note: Accompanying note: NAACP photo.

mods:mods.mods:note: Isaac Woodward, veteran of four years of service, is welcomed in the Blinded Veterans Association by its acting director, Lloyd Greenwood. Woodward's eyes were gouged out by South Carolina troopers while he was on his way home just four hours after his discard from the Army. Although only veterans blinded in the war are eligible to join the B.V.A., Greenwood considers Woodward's injuries entitle him to equal membership.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Franklin H. Williams with Lloyd Greenwood and Isaac Woodward of Blinded Veterans Association.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Isaac Woodward, veteran of four years of service, is welcomed in the Blinded Veterans Association by its acting director, Lloyd Greenwood. Woodward's eyes were gouged out by South Carolina troopers while he was on his way home just four hours after his discard from the Army. Although only veterans blinded in the war are eligible to join the B.V.A., Greenwood considers Woodward's injuries entitle him to equal membership.
